title: New tension when rope is moved

content.question: A horizontal uniform plank is supported by ropes I and II at points P and Q, respectively, as shown above. The two ropes have negligible mass. The tension in rope I is 150 N. The point at which rope II is attached to the plank is now moved to point R halfway between point Q and point C, the center of the plank. The plank remains horizontal. Which of the following are most nearly the new tensions in the two ropes?

choices.label: Tension in I Tension in II 75 N 225 N
Tension in I Tension in II 100 N 200 N
Tension in I Tension in II 112.5 N 112.5 N
Tension in I Tension in II 112.5 N 187.5 N
Tension in I Tension in II 150 N 300 N

content.answer: Tension in I Tension in II 100 N 200 N

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
